managedService.descr: The Knopflerfish OSGi log service implementation

property.name: default.level
property.description: Default log level. Possible values: warning, error, info, and debug
property.helptext: Log entries with severity lower than this level are not saved in the log.

property.name: bundle.log.level
property.description: Default log level for specific bundles.
property.helptext: The value for each bundle indicates which logs are actually saved for that bundle. The full or short bundle location may be entered.

property.name: memory.size
property.description: Number of log entries in memory
property.helptext: The value is the number of log entries that are kept in memory by the log.

property.name: log.out
property.helptext: The value of this boolean property decides if log entries should be sent to the standard console output or not.

property.name: file
property.helptext: The value of this boolean property decides if log entries should be written to a log file or not.

property.name: file.dir
property.helptext: The value is an absolute path to the directory where log files are created. If this value is empty log files will be placed in the data directory of this bundle.

property.name: file.size
property.description: Max size of a log file (characters)
property.helptext: The value is the maximum size of a log file measured in characters.

property.name: file.generations
property.helptext: This value is the number of generations of log files that are kept.

property.name: file.flush
property.description: Flush log file after each log entry
property.helptext: Setting this proprety to true means that the log file will be flushed (written to disk) after each new entry. Setting it to false reduces the number of write operations, but the last few log entries may not get written to the log file if the service gateway crashes.
